Act On Table Element.Description: This attribute allows specifying the action that should be performed when an object is selected from a Table.

Parameters.Keywords: Accept Alter, Accept Create, Accept Object, Action, Add Sheet, Add Tile, Alter, Alter Collection, Alter Column, Alter Current Collection, Alter Current Report, Alter Ex, Alter Object, Alter Target, Append, Audit Form, Audit Object, Auto Columns, Autoform Report, Auto Set, Backup Company, Break, Browse Url, Browse Url Ex, Calculator, Call, Cancel, Cancel Object, Change Crypt Company, Change Output Mode, Change Table, Clear Table Stack, Close Company, Close Encrypted Target File, Close File, Close Target File, Configuration, Continue, Copy File, Copy To Clipboard, Copy Dump Recording, Duplicate, Else, End Batch Post, End Block, End For, End If, End Msg, End Msg Box, End Progress, End Report, End Sub, End Unzip, End Walk, End While, End XSub, End Zip, Exchange, Exec Act On Table Element.Name: Act On Table Element

Add/Replace/Delete.Description: The ADD/Delete/Replace modifiers are used in a definition to Add/Delete/Replace an attribute to the Definition.
Add/Replace/Delete.Name: Add/Replace/Delete

Align.Description: This attribute aligns the particular field as per the string formula stated.

Parameters.Keywords: Bottom, Center, Centre, Justified, Left, Prompt, Right, Top

Align.Name: Align

Alter.Description: Specifies the report name which is to be executed in alter mode based on the condition when Ctrl+E is hit in combination at the field.
Alter.Name: Alter

ASCII Only.Description: It restricts the user input in the field to ASCII characters (English characters) only irrespective of the keyboard language.
ASCII Only.Name: ASCII Only

Auto.Description: The values specified as parameters with the attribute Dynamic, are dynamically added to the table being displayed by the current field.
Auto.Name: Auto

Background.Description: This attribute sets the background color for the field.
Background.Name: Background

Border.Description: Specifies the border for the field.
Border.Name: Border

Border3D.Description: It applies 3D border to the field.
Border3D.Name: Border3D

Bound.Description: This attribute is used typically in auto column reports to restrict the maximum and mimimum width of the field.
Bound.Name: Bound

Cancel.Description: The inactive attribute is used, when the defined field is to be excluded from processing under certain conditions.
Cancel.Name: Cancel

Case.Description: Specifies the case of the text contained in the field.

Parameters.Keywords: All Capital, All Lower, First Upper Case, Lower Case, Normal, Proper Case, Small Case, Title Case, Title Case Exact, Upper Case

Case.Name: Case

Cell.Description: Specifies the number of cells to be occupied for the field content in the excel sheet in case of excel export.
Cell.Name: Cell

Cell Write.Description: Enables writing a cell in the Excel file,before the whole information gets written.
Cell Write.Name: Cell Write

Color.Description: Specifies the fore color of the content of the field.
Color.Name: Color

Common Table.Description: If the attribute Common Table is set Yes, then the same memory is used to access the table for each instance of the field, hence reducing the memory required for the application drastically.
Common Table.Name: Common Table

Control.Description: This attribute pops up a message box with the content as specified in the String Expression when the an invalid value is entered in the field as per condition specified .
Control.Name: Control

Cyclic Behavior.Description: This attribute allows the field to regather the table when the values are changed for the Table.
Cyclic Behavior.Name: Cyclic Behavior

Default Table Item.Description: This attribute facilitates to position the focus of cursor in a Table associated with the field. In the absence of the condition; the focus of the cursor is placed to the first item in the Table.
Default Table Item.Name: Default Table Item

Display.Description: Specifies the report name which is to be executed in Display mode based on the condition when Enter key is hit at the line.
Display.Name: Display

DMPMode.Description: Specify the Dot matrix mode to be used for printing. This is applicable only for dot matrix mode of printing (and ignored in case of other printing modes.
DMPMode.Name: DMPMode

Excel Formula.Description: Specifies the excel formula that needs to be inserted in the excel cell while exporting.
Excel Formula.Name: Excel Formula

Fetch Object.Description: This attribute is used to Fetch Object values dynamically based on current field values.
Fetch Object.Name: Fetch Object

Field.Description: It specifies the field name under the field definitions,where a field can consist of multiple fields within it.

Meta.Aliases: Field, Fields, Left Field, Left Fields

Field.Name: Field

Fixed.Description: The attribute Fixed when used in the field does not allow the user to change the value of the field.
Fixed.Name: Fixed

Format.Description: Specifies the format for the content of field.
Format.Name: Format

Full Width.Description: Specifies whether the field will occupy the remaining width in the line.
Full Width.Name: Full Width

Graph Label.Description: Specifies whether the field value serves as the x-axis Label for the graph.
Graph Label.Name: Graph Label

Graph Value.Description: Specifies whether the field value serves as the x-axis values for the graph.
Graph Value.Name: Graph Value

Graph X Axis Legend Title.Description: This attribute specifies the graph x axis legend title. The default value for this attribute is the description name of the field.
Graph X Axis Legend Title.Name: Graph X Axis Legend Title

Help.Description: This helps to get the help of the area depending upon the context we are in. Specifies the index / id of the help file.
Help.Name: Help

Indent.Description: Specifies an indentation for the field. This formula can decide as to what extent each instance of the field has to be indented from the initial place.
Indent.Name: Indent

Info.Description: Specifies the value to be displayed in the field and overwrites the value specifed with 'Set as'
Info.Name: Info

Invisible.Description: It specifies the condition on which the field should be invisible.
Invisible.Name: Invisible

Is ODBC Table.Description: It controls the Display type for the Table specified with the field with the Table Attribute.

Parameters.Keywords: Always, Always and Never Hide, Default, Never, On Blank, On Empty, On Error, On First Key

Is ODBC Table.Name: Is ODBC Table

JSONTag.Description: To specify the tag name for the field in the exported JSON/XML file. In the absence of this attribute, the tag name defaults to the definition name.
JSONTag.Name: JSONTag

KBLanguage.Description: This is used to set the Language id for the field.
KBLanguage.Name: KBLanguage

Key.Description: Lists the keys associated with the field.
Key.Name: Key

Line.Description: This attribute is used to display more than one line in a field.  By default maximum of 1 line gets displayed.

Meta.Aliases: Line, Lines, Top Line, Top Lines

Line.Name: Line

Local.Description: The Local attribute is used in the context of the definition to set local value within the scope of that definition only.
Local.Name: Local

Local Formula.Description: This is used to specify a local formula within the Field.
Local Formula.Name: Local Formula

Max.Description: This attribute specifies the maximum number of characters that can be entered in the current field.Minimum no. of characters is zero and maximum is 972
Max.Name: Max

Modifies.Description: This attribute is used to update / modify the value of the variable . The value can variable value can be modified either based on the field's acceptance or form's acceptance.
Modifies.Name: Modifies

Notify.Description: Notifies the user based on the condition with a message/ prompt.
Notify.Name: Notify

Object.Description: This is used to specify Object Association at the field level.
Object.Name: Object

On.Description: ON keyword is used to specify a list of Actions to be executed on the occurance of an Event.
On.Name: On

Option.Description: Option is an attribute which can be used by various definitions, to provide a conditional result in a program.
Option.Name: Option

Pre Printed.Description: Specifies whether the static text will be preprinted for the printing.
Pre Printed.Name: Pre Printed

Pre Printed Border.Description: Specifies whether the border for the field will be preprinted for the printing.
Pre Printed Border.Name: Pre Printed Border

Preaccept Object Map.Description: This attribute is used to call the object map before the field accept.
Preaccept Object Map.Name: Preaccept Object Map

Print BG.Description: Specifies the background color of the field in print mode.
Print BG.Name: Print BG

Print FG.Description: Specifies the foreground color of the field in print mode.
Print FG.Name: Print FG

Print Style.Description: This attribute sets the style of font for the field to be printed on the printer.
Print Style.Name: Print Style

Quick Search.Description: It allows the search of the content of the value present in the field by using an alphabet key press.
Quick Search.Name: Quick Search

Read Only.Description: Specifies whether the field content is readonly or not based on the condition.
Read Only.Name: Read Only

Scale.Description: This attribute can be used to specify the scale factor for the value displayed in the field which can be either hundreds,thousands,crores etc.
Scale.Name: Scale

Scroll.Description: Specifies whether the field can be scrolled horizontally or not.
Scroll.Name: Scroll

Set.Description: This attribute sets the value to be displayed / printed by the field.
Set.Name: Set

Set Always.Description: This attribute is used to refresh the values in the field each time the values in the variables / fields it refers to get affected / changed.
Set Always.Name: Set Always

Set By Condition.Description: Specifies the value that is set to the field based on the condition.
Set By Condition.Name: Set By Condition

Skip.Description: This attribute causes the cursor to skip the particular field and hence, the value in the field cannot be altered by the user, even if the report is in Create or Alter mode.
Skip.Name: Skip

Skip Action.Description: This attribute facilitates to position the focus of cursor in a Table associated with the field. Its evaluated if 'Default table item' not specified or condition fails.
Skip Action.Name: Skip Action

Skip Cell.Description: This attribute causes the field to skip the particular field during export
Skip Cell.Name: Skip Cell

Skip Forward.Description: Skips the field forward. When backsapce is hit from the next field then focus moves to this field.
Skip Forward.Name: Skip Forward

Skip SysNames.Description: This attribute when enabled will not store the system names if selected from the table values by the user.
Skip SysNames.Name: Skip SysNames

Space Left.Description: The attribute specifies space to be left on the left of the Field.This space is additional to the field width.
Space Left.Name: Space Left

Space Right.Description: The attribute specifies space to be left on the right of the Field.This space is additional to the field width.
Space Right.Name: Space Right

Storage.Description: Specifies the method of the object where the field value is to be saved.
Storage.Name: Storage

Style.Description: Specifies the style of content of the field.
Style.Name: Style

Sub Form.Description: Specifies the report name which is to be executed when enter key is hit based on the condition.
Sub Form.Name: Sub Form

Sub Title.Description: It specifies whether the field acts as a sub-title or not.
Sub Title.Name: Sub Title

Switch.Description: 'Switch' attribute is similar to the Option attribute but reduces code complexity and improves the performance. The Switch are grouped using a label Once a condition is satisfied from one group, switch won't  check further conditions from the same group.  It will evaluate the conditions from the other groups specified, if any.
Switch.Name: Switch

Table.Description: Specifies the table that is to be displayed for selection of value based on the condition specified.
Table.Name: Table

Table Search.Description: Table Search is used to filter the table by 'Contains' method. Based on the user's inputs, it continuously reduces the table records that are being satisfied using 'Contains' search.
Table Search.Name: Table Search

Tooltip.Description: Specifies the value to be displayed as a tip,if the mouse points to the field.
Tooltip.Name: Tooltip

Trigger.Description: This attribute is used to invoke a report to get the inputs from the user based on the given condition. The user input then can be pushed to the parent field using 'output' attribute at the form level in the trigger report.
Trigger.Name: Trigger

TriggerEx.Description: The attribute Trigger Ex allows to add values to the dynamic table through an expession or user defined functions.
TriggerEx.Name: TriggerEx

Type.Description: Specifies the type of the value of the field.

Parameters.Keywords: Aggregate, Amount, Date, DateTime, Due Date, Duration, FlagSet, Logical, Long, Number, NumSet, Quantity, Rate, Rate of Exchange, String, Sys Id, Time
Alternate Units, Base, Base Units, Date, Direct Base, DrCr, Forced, Forex, Price, Primary Units, Quantity, Rate, Secondary Units, Time, Unit Symbol

Type.Name: Type

Unique.Description: When this attribute is set to Yes the values accepted will be unique with respect to the collection associated with the storage attribute of the field.
Unique.Name: Unique

Use.Description: The USE keyword is used in a definition to reuse an existing definition.
Use.Name: Use

Valid.Description: Validates the value of the field based on the condition.The cursor will not move to the next field until the condition is satisfied.
Valid.Name: Valid

Variable.Description: When the field value is to be accessed as a variable this attribute is used.
Variable.Name: Variable

Wide Space.Description: This allows increased spacing between the characters of the string value specified in the field.
Wide Space.Name: Wide Space

XMLAttr.Description: Specifies the Atrribute and attribute value for the xml tag.
XMLAttr.Name: XMLAttr
